For a moment we don't know who has survived. There is a surge of people milling and shouting. Those who have jumped back out of the way when the merry-go-round toppled, now rush forward again as the cloud of dust settles. From the midway in the background others are running forward. MED. LONG SHOT Distraught parents try to force their way to their children who were on the merry-go-round, but are hold back from the wreckage by police. MED. CLOSE SHOT Guy is somewhat stunned from his fall. He is helped to his feet by some men in the crowd. His knuckles are bleeding. In the background people are rushing about. The crowd is in uproar as women and children are helped from the wreckage. Officials and uniformed policemen pushing back the surge of the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get back. Get back there.    Give us room here. Turley and Campbell rush in to Guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you all right, Haines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, I think so. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Guy is surrounded by police and Campbell stands at his elbow. At this moment the boatman runs in. One of the detectives is with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Turley! Mr. Turley! (indicating boatman) He says this isn't the man we want. (with a nod in Guy's direction) It's the other one -- the one he was fighting with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (stops to give his full attention to this unexpected bit of information) What   do you mean, this isn't the -- (turns to Guy, not quite taking it in) Not   Haines? (back to boatman) But   you said he was. You pointed him   out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I didn't, sir. I've never seen this man before in my life. I meant the other one. The detective who was holding Guy instinctively relax his hold on Guy's arm. Turley turns to Guy, puzzled.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is this all about, Haines?        Did you know he killed your wife?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nods) He has my cigarette   lighter and wanted to plant it there on   the island to pin the whole thing   on me. (urgently) Let me talk to him.      Let me show you. Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Over here. He leads the way.   They follow. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MED. CLOSE SHOT as Guy and Turley enter to the  spot where Bruno is pinned under the overturned machine.   He is caught between two of the horses, the head of one of  them across his chest. Bruno's head sags back somewhat, but is  resting on pieces of debris. A uniformed policeman looks up  from Bruno to Turley:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This one's in a pretty bad way, Mr. Turley. Guy is shocked at the sight of Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking down at Bruno) Can't you get that stuff off him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, they've done everything they can until the crane comes. Bruno opens his eyes and sees Guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Guy. Turley has leaned forward to look at the helpless Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (weakly nodding at Turley) Who's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Mr. Turley, Chief of Police.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a half smile) So they got you at last, eh, Guy? Guy looks around desperately, frustrated for a moment as Turley eyes him stonily. Then he turns again to Bruno.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (rather gently) Can you talk a little? Can you tell the chief you have my lighter? Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with a faint, quizzical smile) I haven't got it. It's still on the island where you left it. Guy looks around helplessly to Turley, who looks back at him suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking down at Bruno) I think he's going. Turley leans over to look. CLOSE SHOT BRUNO'S FIST FROM TURLEY'S VIEWPOINT As Bruno is dying, his closed fist slowly starts to open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's finished. Guy's lighter is now revealed in Bruno's open hand. MED. SHOT GROUP Turley takes the lighter from the dead Bruno's hand. Guy is watching him. Turley straightens up and holds the lighter out to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this your lighter, Haines? Guy nods without speaking, and with a half look in Bruno's direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you were right. (sticks the lighter into his own pocket) I'd better keep this for the time being. (in a friendly tone) We can clear the whole thing out the morning. How about staying in town over night, Haines? I imagine you have a lot to tell me. Nine o'clock, all right? Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SHOT BRUNO'S FIST FROM TURLEY'S VIEWPOINT

direction.raw_text: (nods) Okay, Mr. Turley.   Thanks. Turley turns back to the group around Bruno. Guy looks down for a moment at Bruno, then speaks to the boatman, who is standing nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you tell me where there's a telephone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (indicating) There's one up near the entrance. (with a look back to the dead Bruno) Who was he, Bud? Guy looks back sympathetically in Bruno's direction, speaks without looking at the boatman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bruno. Bruno Antony. (reminiscently and a little compassionately, remembering what Bruno had said of himself) A very clever fellow. He moves off through the crowd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (into phone) Hello... (impatiently) Yes, operator, yes! (waits a moment, then eagerly:) Guy? (MORE) Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. BURTON STUDY NIGHT Anne, Barbara and the Senator are sitting silently in the attitudes of waiting. The telephone rings. Anne is instantly on her feet. Barbara and the Senator watch her anxiously as she goes to answer it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (a pause, then she closes her eyes with heartfelt relief. Another pause, then:) Yes, darling, yes. Of course I'll be there...Goodbye. She hangs up, turns slowly, to face Barbara and her father. Her expression is one of intense relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guy'll be back tomorrow. (overcome with emotion she has difficulty in speaking) He wants me to take him some things. With a sob, Barbara flings herself into Anne's arms. As she cries, Anne strokes her head comfortingly. Then with a half- choked sobs Anne, too, begins to cry. She speaks through her tears, looking over Barbara's shoulder at her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He says he looks silly in his tennis clothes. The Senator eyes them a moment, then speaks a little wryly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I presume from all those tears that you have had good news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I beg your pardon, but aren't you Guy Haines?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (uncomfortably) Yes. Converted to PDF by www.screentalk.org
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : INT. PARLOR OF TRAIN NEXT DAY Anne and Guy are sitting quietly together. Opposite them is a man in a clerical collar who is reading a sports magazine. On the cover is a picture of a tennis player in action. The man looks over the top of his magazine at Guy, with recognition. He leans forward.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . Guy and Anne exchange a  brief look, rise hurriedly and start to walk away before the  conversation can go any farther. The cleric looks after  them with a frown and a puzzled shrug of his shoulders, as if  to say, "Did I  say something wrong?"
direction.name: direction
